rounds.response:
I have 9♥ 4♦ offsuit from the small-blind facing a BB of 10 (effective cost 30 to see the flop).  
9-4 off is a weak hand with little equity and poor playability post-flop. Since the big blind (P1) still has to act and shows a strong tendency to fold to steals (folding every time except once), the correct play here is to let the hand go rather than risk 30 more chips.

[Fold]
